alert.note: Alert for Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 4:43PM MDT until July 25 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTY... At 443 PM MDT, Earlier thunderstorms produced between 0.75 and 1.50 inches of rain in the Red Cliffs recreation area. Flash flooding has been observed at the Red Cliffs Campground within Leeds Creek. Other area creeks and dry washes are likely flowing with water at this time. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Washington, Red Cliffs recreation area, and Quail Creek State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
